author: G_lantern
title: Battle For Naboo
review:
Box/Instructions

Slim box with the main ship proud on display on the front cover. Back of box shows the sets main playable features. Comes with 1 instruction manual.

Parts 

Set has a bunch of grey and  yellow pieces. Set contains a lot of round and curved parts.

Weapons: 1 blue light saber, 3 blasters, 3 blaster pistols, 2 hand cuffs

Minifigures

 You get a lot of good minifigs: 2 battle droids, 1 battle droid commander, 1 young Obi-Wan, 1 Anakin Skywalker (kid), 1 Naboo Pilot, 1 R2-D2, 2 (build) Destroyer Droids.

The build

Total build time: 1hr 30min - 2hrs. Very enjoyable build. The main focus is the fighter, which is symetrical without being tedious. Fun build.

The accessories are cool too. There is a rotating stand for the fight to rest on, a ladder for the pilot to climb, a power or fuel refill station, a missile cart, and a cargo box filled with blasters. Don't forget the buildable destroyer droids which are awesome.

Only con of building this set is there are a ton of stickers. I think there are almost 20 total!

The completed model

Complete model is almost perfect. I wish it also came a Darth Maul, Qui-Gon Jinn and maybe a Naboo Guard but, it portrays the hanger scene pretty well. Best Naboo Star Fighter by far and you get a lot of cool accessories.  

Overall opinion

This set is great. Only complaint would be too many stickers and maybe a few more minifigs.

author: DireStraits85
title: Great Set.
review: This is a great set for young to middle aged fans of Star Wars. It haves 3 droids and 2 destroyer droids to face off against Obi-Wan as he protects Anakin and saves the pilot. It is a beautiful recreation of the Naboo Starfighter and is a great display piece. It's missiles are well hidden into the ship and are fun to launch. This set is good for it's price and would recommend it.
